news_header: Sydney beaches have reopened for swimming after mysterious tar-like balls were found on the shore, prompting health concerns and a clean-up operation.
news_text: Beaches in Sydney have reopened for swimmers after being closed due to the appearance of mysterious black tar-like balls. Tests revealed these balls are made of chemicals similar to those in cosmetics and cleaning products, but their origin remains unknown. Eight beaches, including Bondi, were closed for a clean-up amid fears of toxicity. New South Wales Environment Minister Penny Sharpe stated investigations are ongoing to identify the pollution's source. Officials confirmed the balls are not highly toxic to humans but advised against touching them. The Environment Protection Authority is conducting further tests to determine their origin.
